metadata.Title: CVE-2019-19049 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - negligible.
metadata.Description:
** DISPUTED ** A memory leak in the unittest_data_add() function in drivers/of/unittest.c in the Linux kernel before 5.3.10 allows attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption) by triggering of_fdt_unflatten_tree() failures, aka CID-e13de8fe0d6a. NOTE: third parties dispute the relevance of this because unittest.c can only be reached during boot.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-19049` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-5.3.0-1011-gke - 5.3.0-1011.12~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-5.3.0-1017-raspi2 - 5.3.0-1017.19~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.3.0-1011-gke - 5.3.0-1011.12~18.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> CONFIG_OF_UNITTEST is disabled in xenial-eoan in trusty and before, the option is CONFIG_OF_SELFTEST also disabled

criterions.comment: linux-gke-5.3 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.3.0-1011.12~18.04.1').
linux-raspi2-5.3 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.3.0-1017.19~18.04.1').
linux-signed-gke-5.3 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.3.0-1011.12~18.04.1').
